title: I'm self employed have about 15000 in credit card debt that I can't pay anymore. Can you help?
question: All my bills were paid on time 100% of the time but now do to lack of work I'm not able to pay on time. The credit card companies doubled the min due that I can't pay. I need to pay the mortgage first to keep our home along with the utilitys and food. My wife is disabled and can't work. I do not want to go bankrupt. I get the calls everyday, every 20 to 30 min. apart. The card companies care about nothing but money. WHAT CAN I DO???
answers:
So many people throw in that one liner, "I don't want to go bankrupt." You may have some misconceptions about how Bankruptcy law can provide you with the relief and fresh start that you need. Credit cards are usually an unsecured debt that can be discharged in a Chapter 13, and would allow you the opportunity to keep your home.

Please see a bankruptcy attorney ASAP to evaluate your situation.
